item.title: Democratic leader offers deal to reopen government but Republicans sneer
item.description: The U.S. government shutdown has dragged on for 38 days because of a dispute over whether ACA tax credits should be included in a stop-gap funding bil...

item.title: SNAP benefits: Trump admin tells states it will fully fund food stamps as appeal continues
item.description: The Trump administration tried not to pay for any food stamps in November because of the government shutdown. It now proposes partial SNAP benefits.

item.title: Trump pardons New York baseball star Darryl Strawberry for tax evasion conviction
item.description: President Donald Trump has pardoned multiple high-profile figures since returning to the White House, including Binance founder Changpeng Zhao.

item.title: Cornell University to pay $60 million in deal with Trump administration to restore federal funding
item.description: Cornell joins the University of Virginia, Columbia and Brown in bowing to the Trump administration's interpretation of civil rights laws.

item.title: SNAP benefits must be fully paid by Trump administration by Friday, judge orders
